plants.name: Rhododendron ponticum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub native to the British Isles and parts of Europe, known for its large clusters of bell-shaped flowers that bloom profusely in spring.
plants.location: Western Europe, especially UK and Ireland
plants.funFact: Rhododendron ponticum can form dense thickets that shade out native plants, making it invasive in some areas.

plants.name: Magnolia stellata
plants.description: A deciduous shrub or small tree native to Japan, producing fragrant, white star-shaped flowers early in spring before leaves emerge.
plants.location: East Asia (native); cultivated globally in temperate climates
plants.funFact: Star magnolia flowers have between 12 and 18 narrow tepals, giving them their distinctive star-like appearance.

plants.name: Nicotiana alata
plants.description: A species of flowering plant widely grown as an ornamental for its fragrant tubular flowers that usually open at dusk, attracting pollinators like moths.
plants.location: Native to South America; widely cultivated in gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Nicotiana alata emits a strong sweet fragrance during the evening to attract nocturnal pollinators.

plants.name: Elders (Sambucus nigra)
plants.description: A deciduous shrub or small tree native to Europe and North America, known for its large clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring.
plants.funFact: Elderflowers have been used traditionally to make elderflower cordial and elderflower wines due to their distinctive flavor.
